headline: Creamy Peanut Butter Fudge
description: Peanut butter and marshmallow creme are the key ingredients in this cooked fudge.

video.description: This smooth fudge combines the flavors of peanut and marshmallow. Delicious!
video.name: Creamy Peanut Butter Fudge

name: Creamy Peanut Butter Fudge

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar, brown sugar, butter and evaporated milk. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly, and boil for 7 minutes.
Remove from heat; stir in marshmallow creme until well incorporated and melted.
Stir in peanut butter and vanilla until smooth. Spread in prepared pan. Let cool before cutting into squares.
Spread in prepared pan. Let cool before cutting into squares.

review.reviewBody: Been using this recipe for years and everyone raves about how creamy it is. Thanks again for this recipe

Mine turned out a little drier than I like. I followed the 7 min and even used a candy thermometer trying not to mess it up, pb fudge is my fave. This was identical in taste to the Alton Brown's microwave fudge using pb, butter, &powdered sugar. I think next time, I'll try 6 mins to see if I can get a bit creamier texture. Unless anybody has a diff suggestion.
great fudge I make it with extra chunky and mexican vanilla

This is the most heavenly, creamiest peanut butter fudge I have ever made! It’s a bit on the softer side, but not a dealbreaker for me—I actually preferred it that way. I couldn’t stop eating it! I gave some away at Christmas time and everyone raved about it. This is now my go-to recipe for PBF!

This was my first fudge ever, and it was so good and creamy! I made it at some point in the early 2000s and printed, then lost the recipe until tonight (2022) when I found it hidden in my recipe box. I'm so happy because I've been looking for it since. It's easy, and does make a lot.

I made this according to instructions. It said to spread into the pan. Well…I poured it into the pan after all ingredients were put in. It looks like a swirl of peanut butter and cream. It’s been 3 hours and it’s still hasn’t given me that fudge texture I think we all love. I’m not sure what went wrong….making Buckeyes I guess
I substituted 40 regular marshmallows for the marshmallow creme. It was perfect.

This is by far the easiest peanut butter fudge recipe I've come across. It always sets up and I mean always. No matter the humidity in the air, altitude or knowledge of the fudge maker, it doesn't fail as long as you stick strictly to the 7 minute rule. Please note, the 7 minute count down needs to begin when the mixture is at a full boil and not just bubbling a little. I've made this recipe countless times and it never fails to deliver perfectly creamy fudge with just the right amount of everything!!
I used a candy thermometer to soft ball stage. Did not stir after it started the boil. It was perfect
Delicious! I added a little butter while cooking. Before putting it in the pan I added some mini marshmallows and Walnuts. The marshmallows don’t melt so It made Rocky road fudge and is pretty good!
Too much evaporated milk. It seems to have made fudge too soft. I would make it again using less milk next time.
The best fudge!
I make this recipe every year for Christmas. My Grandkids absolutely love this peanut butter fudge. I also add walnuts.
I made no changes and I have made it for many years. I need to print off a new page and my granddaughter wants one also.

Amen sister, leave it as it is! Also if you are adding stuff and rearranging the recipe then you are NOT reviewing it, you are writing your own recipe.Ever hear of a simple "it's good" or "it's bad" ??!! Get over yourself, nobody cares!
Made one batch of regular PB with the recipe and then made a batch of PB and honey. Just eyeballed the honey till I was satisfied. Thanks for the recipe! I'll definitely be using it again!!
Followed the directions exactly as written. Easy and delicious!
Perfect! No issues or adjustments, rave reviews.
Sorry the brown sugar taste overwhelmed the fudge. Idk like it at all. It was also overcooked when I followed your directions
Perfecto! I followed the recipe and it came out perfect. Best creamy peanut butter fudge I’ve ever had.

Delicious! Waited for a good rolling boil, took a little while to get there. I used a medium pan but as soon as I stopped stirring for the 7 minute boil, the mixture boiled over everywhere. This is a very forgiving recipe and I quickly transferred to a large pot without any negative effects on the fudge. Definitely will make it again, in a bigger pan next time, lol.

Mine came out very soft but still able to cut into chunks. I was hoping for a little harder fudge. Tasted sweet as normal with good peanut butter flavor. Will not make it again this way for I like a harder fudge.

Love this recipe, so creamy and good flavor! A friend at work shared it after bringing some to work. First fudge I've ever made, followed recipe/video to a T. Except I had a candy thermometer and out of curiosity I put it in at the 7 minute mark and the temp was a little below soft ball so I left it boiling a couple extra minutes just to be sure.

Love this recipe. Replaced my old recipe with it when I found my old recipe coming out too sugary . I do add 3 tablespoons of cocoa to the butter and sugar mixture from my old recipe. This gives the fudge a rich color and does not change the taste. I did appreciate the advice not to stir once the seven minute boiling stage begins. This year‘s Christmas batch was the best fudge I ever made and the best fudge I ever had.

I made this exactly how it was written. It was creamy and absolutely delicious.
Make sure it comes to a full boil before you start timing the 7 minutes, and do stir constantly while it's coming to a boil (about 4-5 minutes) and during the boiling itself.
This was an easy recipe to do!! I, personally don’t like peanut butter, but everyone else in the family loves it!!
As close to fool-proof as a recipe for fudge gets. Follow it exactly, and you will get success.
Used this recipe and made 4 batches of fudge that turned out ok.

After reading reviews, I was reluctant to make because I didn’t have a candy thermometer but then I read one review that said no thermometer needed!!! And that person was right!!! It wasn’t needed! I did not stir in the 7 minutes it was boiling as others suggested! It turned out great! Smooth and just what I was looking for!
My family’s new favorite! I make 1/2 peanut butter (using 1 cup peanut butter) and 1/2 chocolate (using 2 cups 72% cacao chocolate chips) and it is outstanding!!!
DEFINITELY follow the directions! Silt it it constantly, but Once it hits the rolling boil, STOP and set your timer for 7 minutes. It turned out perfectly!

I’m not sure what happened but I had to boil mine for 10-11 minutes.. I put the candy thermometer in @ 7 minutes just to check.. I’ve only made fudge using the thermometer & it wasn’t @ soft boil stage yet.. but it turned out Great! I’m just so glad I followed my instinct & checked! This fudge is delicious
Great fudge turned out perfect followed directions exactly
SOOOO GOOOOD - and so easy! One pan to prep, no thermometers and absolutely delicious fudge! Make it - you won't be disappointed!!
Just follow the instructions as written and you’ll have the most amazing fudge!
Thanks so much
I made it exactly like the recipe and it was very good and easy. It was very creamy.

I modified this recipe to use less sugar, substituting stevia for the white sugar but used only 1 cup stevia for the 4 c. of white sugar, but still used the 1 c. of brown sugar though, plus I used mini marshmallows instead of the marshmallow crème. Also added 1/2 c. of Baker's Cocoa, whisked in well before boiling the first batch of ingredients. After adding the marshmallows, peanut butter and vanilla extract, I added 1 cup of uncooked oats and 1 cup of rice krispies and divided the recipe into 2-8 inch square pans. I plan on using these bars as a substitute for breakfast bars. These are chilling at the moment and when pouring the final result into the pans the texture seemed thick enough to set up, yet nice had a fluffy, light texture, so I am anxious to try them after letting them chill a few hours.

Love This stuff. I took some to my uncle for the Christmas since he hasn't ever heard of it and apparently none was left for my aunt to try when she came back home from her trip! I've made this for my coworkers about 3-4 times now and they love it. The recipe is great as is. No need for any tweaks in my opinion.
Perfect! No changes necessary.
Super easy to make. Keep it covered and only cut what you are going to eat and it won't dry out. It is very rich so a little goes a long way.
Really good and creamy. I used a hand mixer after removing from heat to achieve a nice creamy texture.

I make fudge and this recipe is very easy with no candy thermometer needed. It is smooth and delicious. It is very sweet but luckily I have a sweet tooth. The only negative thing about the recipe is, it doesn't tell you not to scrape the sides of the pot. Never ever scrape the sides of the pot while making any fudge or it will come out gritty.
I followed the recipe exactly and it turned our great! My husband loved it. I will make it again. I lined the pan with foil and buttered it.
Easy and delicious recipe. A total hit with fri nds and family.
yeah besides the recipe, I added a maple flavor, also used peanut butter morsels & peanut butter included, haven't sample it yet, but looks scrumptious!
Our family favorite! I don’t change a thing & it’s perfect every time.

Irritating that instructions don’t tell you not to stir during the 7 minute boil. First time fudge makers need to know this! I assumed it would burn if not stirred! Also, it doesn’t state how much peanut butter in cups if all you have is the huge jar. First batch crystally and doesn’t taste very peanut buttery. I’m going to make another batch once I buy the 16oz jar of peanut butter. I’ll be back to update.
Never set properly. Was too soft . Ended up just mushing into a jar and eating with a spoon. Tastey, when need a sugar high. But not fudge.

This is one of the best fudge recipes I've ever used. It's always gone immediately and everyone is asking for more. I followed the recipe exactly. No candy thermometer or ball stages and it's turned out perfect every time!
Love it!!!

Just made today. Followed directions exactly. Found the finished product a tad dry tasting, not creamy. When I did the final step adding the peanut butter and mixing til blended, did I blend too much? I only folded it in. Hubby thought it was a bit too sweet. I think I will go back to simpler recipes.
Excellent. I used to use a recipe similar but this is so much better. I added chopped peanuts. Thank you for sharing.
Amazing! I had to use actual marshmallows instead of the marshmallow creme because I couldn't find it at the grocery store. I added about a half a bag during boiling. It turned out delicious :)
creamy melt in your mouth delicious! easy to make, especially after watching the video. my new annual holiday treat to share
This is so good! I love the big batch. I did cook to soft ball stage. Guess the 7 minutes might be based on your stove--electric or gas?
It is the easiest and Best tasting recipe for fudge. I have tried other recipes and there is no comparison the taste is so smooth an delicious. Thank you for sharing it with us.
No I didn't make any changes to it it is so creamy and delicious
Simple and easy..just remember to not stir during 7 minute boil.

The flavor first of all was delicious but after my family and I ate a few pieces we threw the rest away. It did not set well to form fudge it appeared greasy at the bottom and would not set at all. I feel like I did something wrong as the reviews were great. I did not stir it constantly I misread and thought it said occasionally lol! So any advice on how to get it to set would be amazing. The taste alone is worth several more tries.

I have made this multiple times always following the recipe exactly. Each time it turns out perfect. I always use crunchy peanut butter because I like the little peanut nuggets. Quick and easy and a favorite in our home!
So easy! Stir constantly until it’s boiling, don’t touch it for 7 mins, move it from heat & add the rest! Everyone loves it
Followed the directions exactly. Turned out great!
I have continued to use this recipe and it has never let me down!
This is a simple and delicious fudge recipe. I used 13 marshmallows and 1/4 c corn syrup instead of fluff only because I didn't have fluff. it makes a very large batch.
This is the best fudge recipe ever. I accidentally left out the stick of butter, and it was still amazing! Can't wait to make it again....with the butter!
Easy to make!
I made this recipe last year at Christmas. Probably the very best peanut butter fudge I’ve ever made. Or eaten!!

This simple and easy recipe does not take a lot of time to make but the delight that you get in eating it is well worth it. This is the creamiest peanut butter fudge I have ever made. My family loves it.

Well, this was my first time making fudge and I was excited since there were apparently other first timers that had success by following the recipe exactly. I did this, exactly as it states. I followed everything to the T and I guess I still messed it up. Everything seemed fine until I added the peanut butter, and it immediately turned from liquid into crumbles. I'm not sure what I did wrong but I'm upset it wasn't as easy as everyone claimed it to be. I pressed it into the 9X13 since it wasn't spreadable.
Great recipe, turns good each time

Everyone that I've made this for loves it. I get several requests to bring it to parties. Made it for Easter Sunday this year, there was none left. You can also freeze it and it still tastes just as good.
GREAT RECIPE,TURNED OUT REALLY GOOD FOR ME..
perfect
First time I ever made fudge and my husband said he never tasted better:)
Best recipe ever. When I made according to directions turned out great the first time.
Everyone raves when I make this fudge! It is simply the best!
I made the peanut butter recipe as written, perfect! Tried making it as chocolate fudge and it came out crumbly, not creamy. Only my third attempt at fudge, two out of three's not bad!
Super easy! Nailed it the first try. Very creamy and peanut-buttery, makes a big batch. Thanks for the great recipe!

I agree with another reviewer that these are too sweet. I thought they would be since the amount of sugar is so much more than other fudge recipes on this site, but I needed to use up some evaporated milk so I gave it a shot. I do like the fact a thermometer does not need to be used, but like another reviewer said, it should be clear to bring the fudge ingredients to a full boil before timing for seven minutes. Other than these two issues, it would be a very good recipes. I won't make it again based on these assertions. However, I always appreciate members sharing their recipes.
I've made this several times and it is the best peanut butter fudge recipe I've ever made. Followed the directions to a tee and works perfectly every time.
First time I ever made fudge and it was 1) easy and 2) delicious! Thank you :)

Best PB fudge I have ever made. It is creamy and satisfying. It is easy to make.
Wow, enjoyed this recipe for the holidays!

The only recipe for peanut butter fudge I make and it always comes out just right and delicious. I follow the recipe exactly and have never used a candy thermometer because I don't need to, just boil it for seven minutes.

Other reviews say to ignore the seven.minutes and use a candy thermometer. I wouldn't do that..that just makes it less likely to turn out right.

I always thought Mom made the best peanut butter fudge, made this last night, very to easy to make and so creamy. Will be keeping this recipe. First time making fudge too.

This is my new go to for peanut butter fudge. It was a hit with all my family. I’ve already made a second batch! Do exactly as the recipe says and you will not fail. This fudge gets better with some age. Keep in air tight container. Freezes well for short time. (30days)
